intro: Laelia monophylla, commonly known as the single-leaf orchid, is a species native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, humid climates. The plant features a single, fleshy leaf that is often broad and succulent, adapted to store water in its native environment. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with a distinctive spurred lip. Laelia monophylla is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
